page.title: 13LESWALT YOUTH ASSOC's (1)
page.content: The 1st Leswalt Brownies, founded in 1951 presently organised by Mrs. E. Jamieson, cater, with local association support, for girls of 7-10 years. Activities include normal Brownie ring and prayers plus indoor and outdoor games and craftwork. Special activities are planned for e.g. Halloween and Christmas Pantos and a bulb-planting ceremony for 1985- 75 years of guiding. All girls of the age group in the area are members and funds are raised by subscription. 1st Kirkcolm Guides cater for girls of 10-15. Founded in 1928 and organised now by Mrs. B. Smith, the pack includes 31 girls from Leswalt and Kirkcolm districts. Activities are more adult versions of the Brownies and ceremonies include taps horseshoe and camp-fire singing. A special 7 day camp, under canvas, was held in 1985
